creator: Ivan Mehta
title: (No AI) Canva acquires startups working on animation and marketing
dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
content: With the new acquisitions, the company wants to bolster its position as a marketing solution by potentially adding video creation and more granular measurement.
contentSnippet: With the new acquisitions, the company wants to bolster its position as a marketing solution by potentially adding video creation and more granular measurement.

creator: Julie Bort
title: (No AI) A Meta AI security researcher said an OpenClaw agent ran amok on her inbox
dc:creator: Julie Bort
content: The viral X post from an AI security researcher reads like satire. But it's really a word of warning about what can go wrong when handing tasks to an AI agent.
contentSnippet: The viral X post from an AI security researcher reads like satire. But it's really a word of warning about what can go wrong when handing tasks to an AI agent.

title: (No AI) Inside Anthropic’s existential negotiations with the Pentagon
author: Tina Nguyen
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/268367_dod_and_anthropics_public_fight_over_lethal_autonomous_weapons_a_mass_surveillance_CVirginia.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Anthropic's weekslong battle with the Department of Defense has played out over social media posts, admonishing public statements, and direct quotes from unnamed Pentagon officials to the news media. But the future of the $380 billion AI startup comes down to just three words: "any lawful use." The new terms, which OpenAI and xAI have [reportedly](https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2026/02/22/pentagon-anthropic-ai-dispute/) already agreed to, would give the US military carte blanche to use services for mass surveillance and lethal autonomous weapons, AI that has full power to track and kill targets with no humans involved in the decision-making process.

The negotiations have turned ugly, with Pentagon CTO Emil Michael …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/883456/anthropic-pentagon-department-of-defense-negotiations)
contentSnippet:
Anthropic's weekslong battle with the Department of Defense has played out over social media posts, admonishing public statements, and direct quotes from unnamed Pentagon officials to the news media. But the future of the $380 billion AI startup comes down to just three words: "any lawful use." The new terms, which OpenAI and xAI have reportedly already agreed to, would give the US military carte blanche to use services for mass surveillance and lethal autonomous weapons, AI that has full power to track and kill targets with no humans involved in the decision-making process. 
The negotiations have turned ugly, with Pentagon CTO Emil Michael …
Read the full story at The Verge.

But the future of the $380 billion AI startup comes down to just three words: "any lawful use." The new terms, which OpenAI and xAI have […]

title: (No AI) Anthropic accuses DeepSeek and other Chinese firms of using Claude to train their AI
author: Emma Roth
content:
![Anthropic logo on an orange and grey background.](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/01/STK269_ANTHROPIC_2_C.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Anthropic claims DeepSeek and two other Chinese AI companies misused its Claude AI model in an attempt to improve their own products. In [an announcement on Monday](https://www.anthropic.com/news/detecting-and-preventing-distillation-attacks), Anthropic says the "industrial-scale campaigns" involved the creation of around 24,000 fraudulent accounts and more than 16 million exchanges with Claude, as reported [earlier by _The Wall Street Journal_](https://www.wsj.com/tech/ai/anthropic-accuses-chinese-companies-of-siphoning-data-from-claude-63a13afc).

The three companies - DeepSeek, MiniMax, and Moonshot - are accused of ["distilling" Claude](https://www.ibm.com/think/topics/knowledge-distillation), or training a smaller AI model based on a more advanced one. Though Anthropic says that distillation is a "legitimate training method," it adds that it can "also be used for illicit purpose …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/883243/anthropic-claude-deepseek-china-ai-distillation)

In an announcement on Monday, Anthropic says the "industrial-scale campaigns" involved the creation of around 24,000 fraudulent accounts and more than 16 million exchanges with Claude, as reported earlier by The Wall Street Journal.
The three companies - DeepSeek, MiniMax, and Moonshot - are accused of "distilling" Claude, or training a smaller AI model based on a more advanced one. Though Anthropic says that distillation is a "legitimate training method," it adds that it can "also be used for illicit purpose …
Read the full story at The Verge.

title: (No AI) Why we no longer evaluate SWE-bench Verified
content: SWE-bench Verified is increasingly contaminated and mismeasures frontier coding progress. Our analysis shows flawed tests and training leakage. We recommend SWE-bench Pro.
contentSnippet: SWE-bench Verified is increasingly contaminated and mismeasures frontier coding progress. Our analysis shows flawed tests and training leakage. We recommend SWE-bench Pro.

title: (No AI) OpenAI announces Frontier Alliance Partners
content: OpenAI announces Frontier Alliance Partners to help enterprises move from AI pilots to production with secure, scalable agent deployments.
contentSnippet: OpenAI announces Frontier Alliance Partners to help enterprises move from AI pilots to production with secure, scalable agent deployments.

title: (No AI) Gemini 3.1 Pro: A smarter model for your most complex tasks
content: 3.1 Pro is designed for tasks where a simple answer isn’t enough.
contentSnippet: 3.1 Pro is designed for tasks where a simple answer isn’t enough.

title: (No AI) A new way to express yourself: Gemini can now create music
content: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.
contentSnippet: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.

creator: Michael Pollan
title: (No AI) AI Will Never Be Conscious
dc:creator: Michael Pollan
content: In his new book, A World Appears, Michael Pollan argues that artificial intelligence can do many things—it just can’t be a person.
contentSnippet: In his new book, A World Appears, Michael Pollan argues that artificial intelligence can do many things—it just can’t be a person.

creator: Brian Barrett, Zoë Schiffer, Leah Feiger
title: (No AI) Uncanny Valley: AI Researchers’ Resignations, Bots Hiring Humans, Evie Magazine’s Party
dc:creator: Brian Barrett, Zoë Schiffer, Leah Feiger
content: This episode of Uncanny Valley covers the people resigning from AI companies and the humans getting hired by AI agents. Plus, we attend a soiree thrown by a conservative women's magazine.
contentSnippet: This episode of Uncanny Valley covers the people resigning from AI companies and the humans getting hired by AI agents. Plus, we attend a soiree thrown by a conservative women's magazine.
